TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , who is of NORP origin and whose nationality is unknown , was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mrs B. GPE , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON u PERSON ) gave judgment ordering company A. ( “ the company ” ) to pay the applicant the amount of MONEY ( “ YUD ” ) together with the pertaining statutory interest and the litigation costs . The judgment became final on DATE when it was upheld by ORG ) .
On DATE the applicant applied to ORG ( PERSON u ORG ) for enforcement of the above judgment .

On DATE ORG issued a writ of execution ( rješenje o izvršenju ) ordering the financial institution operating the company ’s account ( ORG društvenog knjigovodstva , subsequently PERSON and eventually PERSON agencija ) ( “ the ORG ” ) to collect the amount corresponding to the applicant ’s claim , i.e. CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ORG , and transfer it to his account .
On DATE the company filed an objection ( prigovor ) to the writ . The applicant replied on DATE .
On DATE ORG dismissed the company ’s objection and the writ thereby became final . It appears that on DATE the writ was sent to the ORG in order to be carried out .

The Government submitted that the proceedings had ended on DATE . However , since the case - file had been closed and , eventually , destroyed on DATE pursuant to section CARDINAL of the Courts’ Rules ( see below under the Relevant domestic law ) , the Government were unable to specify whether the proceedings had been terminated because the applicant ’s claim had been satisfied or for some other reason .

The applicant submitted that in DATE he had gone to stay with his parents in GPE . He further submitted that due to the escalation of the war in GPE in DATE , he had been unable to return . Thus , he had decided to stay in GPE where he had later on been granted refugee status .
The applicant also submitted that since DATE he had not received any information from ORG concerning his case .
On DATE he wrote to ORG asking it to continue the enforcement proceedings . He received no reply .

On DATE the applicant , through his advocate PERSON , repeated his request . The court replied on DATE informing the applicant ’s advocate that the enforcement proceedings at issue had been discontinued and the case - file destroyed .
On DATE and DATE the applicant again requested ORG to continue the enforcement proceedings .

On DATE he wrote to the President of ORG complaining that he had received no reply to his previous letters . The President replied on CARDINAL DATE informing the applicant that the proceedings had ended on DATE , and the case - file had been destroyed on DATE .
Meanwhile , following the applicant ’s enquiry about the writ of execution , on DATE the ORG – ORG informed him that it had never received the writ from ORG .

The DATE LAW ( Zakon o izvršnom postupku , ORG nos . CARDINAL and DATE ) , in force at the material time , did not provide for a possibility to continue enforcement proceedings that had already ended but only those that had been stayed or postponed ( section CARDINAL ) . Moreover , the LAW provided that a petition for reopening of a case ( prijedlog za ponavljanje postupka ) was not allowed as a remedy in the enforcement proceedings ( section CARDINAL ) .

LAW ( Ovršni zakon , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , which entered into force on DATE , contains the same rules on continuation of the proceedings ( sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) and reopening of a case ( section CARDINAL ) .

The Courts’ Rules ( ORG poslovnik , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) , as in force at the material time , regulated , inter alia , time - limits for keeping case - files in archives of the courts . They provided that the case - files concerning enforcement proceedings had to be kept for DATE following the discontinuation or termination of such proceedings , unless they concerned rights in rem , in which case the files had to be kept for DATE ( section CARDINAL ) . After the expiry of those time - limits the case - files had to either be delivered to the institution keeping historical archives or be destroyed ( section CARDINAL ) .
